sentences: Sport ja muusika – need on poisi hing.
context: The Estonian word 'hing' has multiple meanings: 1) breath or breathing (e.g., when something suffocates you), 2) soul, life-force, living being (especially humans), 3) the essence or spirit of someone/something, 4) a person in colloquial use. It can refer to physical breath as well as spiritual/philosophical concepts like the soul. The word appears in various expressions like 'hing kinni' (breath held/closed) and phrases describing someone's character or essence.
